title: Can anyone ID this font please?
content:
Hi everyone,

I'm hoping someone can ID this font for me please;

[http://ecx.images-amazon.com/images/I/51Sx1ZzqysL.\_BO2,204,203,200\_PIsit...](http://web.archive.org/web/20131016215749/http:/ecx.images-amazon.com/images/I/51Sx1ZzqysL._BO2,204,203,200_PIsitb-sticker-arrow-click,TopRight,35,-76_SX342_SY445_CR,0,0,342,445_SH20_OU02_.jpg "http://ecx.images-amazon.com/images/I/51Sx1ZzqysL.\_BO2,204,203,200\_PIsitb-sticker-arrow-click,TopRight,35,-76\_SX342\_SY445\_CR,0,0,342,445\_SH20\_OU02\_.jpg")

I'm after the font used for the 'F' character. I appreciate this may be difficult (or impossible) with just one letter, but hopefully someone out there will know!

Any help greatly appreciated.

Many thanks

Hennree
author: hennree

comments.content: I doubt that you will find such a font; you might, however, find similar letters in a book on mediæval lettering and illumination. Dover Books has several at very reasonable prices.

This fancy letter would have been drawn by a monk illuminating a medieval manuscript. The sample image is small but the F seems to include Celtic knots, a common theme in the initial letters used in famous manuscripts such as the Irish [\_Book of Kells\_](http://web.archive.org/web/20131016215749/http:/en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Book_of_Kells).  
Too fancy for a font, but a vector version of this F may be available. A Google search for [vector Celtic illuminated manuscripts](http://web.archive.org/web/20131016215749/https:/www.google.ca/search?q=vector+celtic+illuminated+manuscripts&client=firefox-a&rls=org.mozilla:en-US:official&tbm=isch&tbo=u&source=univ&sa=X&ei=rhK_UZKxJMLVqAGcn4C4CQ&ved=0CCoQsAQ&biw=1074&bih=906) will lead you to similar letters, and with some perseverance you might find a vector of the initial F used on the book cover.  
A good assortment of old fancy initial capitals, but not including this particular F, can be found at [Aridi initial capitals](http://web.archive.org/web/20131016215749/http:/www.aridi.com/index.php/component/content/article?id=41).  
Don
Thanks for your help you two.
